Unfortunately no. We have pretty strict rules in our design system for where and how primary (filled in) and secondary (outlined) action buttons can show up. The rule is one primary and one secondary per page/screen at most. We don't always follow that perfectly but that's the goal. It wouldn't be in the best interest of our users or the usability of our product to open that up and risk have multiple primary actions on a given page or screen.

I hear you. fwiw those are the same styles we use internally across the product for everything outside the 1-per-page rule. So it aligns with the rest of the product and will be recognizable to HubSpot users.

[UX hat]
The styles + guidelines together are meant to help reduce overall cognitive load on a single page/workflow, and make sure the most salience (hence attention) is directed where we intend in a given context.
